docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 24 -- Adlai Stevenson traveled to South America to gather facts and opinions for President Kennedy's Alliance for Progress, to mend political fences, and as it turned out, to be something of a guinea pig.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 24 -- Adlai Stevenson traveled to South America to gather facts and opinions for President Kennedy's Alliance for Progress, to mend political fences, and as it turned out, to be something of a guinea pig.

headline.main: THE LATIN PROBLEMS AS OUTLINED TO STEVENSON; Support for Castro, Decline in Economy and Need for States To Help Themselves Are the Major Impressions of His Tour

docs.snippet: During the past week the weakness of the Canadian dollar was the principal feature of the foreign exchange market. The dollar fell to the lowest level since December, 1951, when it sold at a discount of 3 1/4 on Wednesday. The pronounced weakness was...
docs.lead_paragraph: During the past week the weakness of the Canadian dollar was the principal feature of the foreign exchange market. The dollar fell to the lowest level since December, 1951, when it sold at a discount of 3 1/4 on Wednesday. The pronounced weakness was the result of the presentation of a deficit budget by the Finance Minister. It closed at 3 3/32 cents discount, a loss of 3.09 cents.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended June 23, 1961

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 27 -- Gov. Luis Munoz Marin of Puerto Rico said today that the answer to the Cuban problem was to "put as much strength and speed as possible behind the Alliance for Progress in Latin America."
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 27 -- Gov. Luis Munoz Marin of Puerto Rico said today that the answer to the Cuban problem was to "put as much strength and speed as possible behind the Alliance for Progress in Latin America."
docs.abstract: Gov Munoz holds speed and strength in US aid is best answer to Castro problem, int after conf with Kennedy; illus

headline.main: Munoz Marin Visits Kennedy, Urges Solid Latin Aid

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 28 -- President Kennedy defended his staffing of Latin-American affairs today with the observation that ferment and controversy were better than orderly stagnation.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 28 -- President Kennedy defended his staffing of Latin-American affairs today with the observation that ferment and controversy were better than orderly stagnation.
docs.abstract: Kennedy defends Adm against criticism of Latin Amer affairs handling, news conf; holds 'ferment' and 'controversy' indicate activity; notes difficulties of filling Under Sec post; lauds Woodward; indicates resentment of criticism

headline.main: KENNEDY DEFENDS HIS LATIN STAFF; Says Controversy Is Better Than Orderly Stagnation

docs.snippet: SPRINGFIELD, N.J., June 28 -- A field of eighty-six golfers faces a formidable test as the women's United States Open golf championship starts here tomorrow. The site is the lower course of the Baltusrol Golf Club.
